metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the linux-def:inetlisteningservers_test is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the linux-def:inetlisteningservers_test.

notes.note: It is important to note that the values used in this test definition are specific to a particular machine, and may not necessarily apply to your system. As a result, in order to have the definition return a result of 'true', you must either change these values to the ones found on your particular system, or you must configure your system to use these values.

criterion.comment: Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the protocol entity equal to some value, the local_address entity equal to some value, and the local_port entity equal to some value.

Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the protocol entity not equal to some value, the local_address entity not equal to some value, and the local_port entity not equal to some value.

Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the protocol entity matching some regular expression, the local_address entity matching some regular expression, and the local_port entity matching some regular expression.

inetlisteningservers_test.comment: Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the protocol entity equal to some value, the local_address entity equal to some value, and the local_port entity equal to some value.

Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the protocol entity not equal to some value, the local_address entity not equal to some value, and the local_port entity not equal to some value.

Test that the inetlisteningservers_object is supported with the protocol entity matching some regular expression, the local_address entity matching some regular expression, and the local_port entity matching some regular expression.

inetlisteningservers_object.comment: This object represents a inetlisteningservers_object with the protocol equal to 'tcp', the local_address equal to '127.0.0.1', and the local_port equal to '25'.
This object represents a inetlisteningservers_object with the protocol not equal to 'udp', the local_address not equal to '0.0.0.0', and the local_port not equal to '0'.

This object represents a inetlisteningservers_object with the protocol matching the regular expression '^t.p$', the local_address matching the regular expression '^[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+$', and the local_port matching the regular expression '^[0-9]+$'.

inetlisteningservers_state.comment: This inetlisteningservers_state represents an inetlisteningservers_item which has a protocol equal to 'tcp', a local_address equal to '127.0.0.1', and a local_port equal to '25'.
This inetlisteningservers_state represents inetlisteningservers_items which have a protocol not equal to 'udp', a local_address not equal to '0.0.0.0', and a local_port not equal to '0'.

This inetlisteningservers_state represents inetlisteningservers_items which have a protocol that matches the regular expression '^t.p$', a local_address that matches the regular expression '^[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+\.[0-9]+$', and a local_port that matches the regular expression '^[0-9]+$'.
